	{
		"review": "Amazon wants you to get used to asking alexa for everything, but while she can answer questions she can't DO simple things like simply search for bluetooth devices, tell you what she finds and you tell her the one to pair to. Nope. Anything remotely technical requires you to use this app. And this app is painful to use. It starts off tyrying to push echo dot conversations on me. It's got 3 buttons that all seem to do the same thing (start conversations with people over echos). If you tell alexa to conncet to bluetooth she tells you to use this app (why? Its the 21st century! Why cant you just find and pair without me having to manually do it in an app), but she then says to install the skill in smart home. Smart home, list devices.. Cant find bluetooth speakers. Ok, skills, i guess i have to install a stupid skill for bluetooth. The skills section of the app is a hot mess. The search funtion flatout DOES NOT WORK. On top of that, apparently we're still in the dark ages of smart devices because every vendor under the sun has their own stupid skills app they want you to install on alexa. This s reams of no standadizations yet. Alexa shouldnt need to learn \"skills\" to connect to smart devices. She has to simply because smart device manufacturers havent standardized things yet. Everyone of them wants to be primma donna with their own skill app, so in addition to painfully digging for it, you have to pray the vendor actually put time into making it work (theres a reason they have star ratings on the skills...ugh). Anyways, i have to google up how to pair alexa to bluetooth speakers (that very necessity means alexa is failing at her GD job, bc she tells me to go to this stupid app instead of doing it directly, and this app is a hot mess to use). There is a bluetooth section. But the app can only seem to find ONE device at a time. Your device didnt show up? Hit back and try again, like you're at a roullette table hoping your number comes up. Ugh! Finally my speakers show up, and the app sits there trying to connect. My phone takes like 2 seconds to connect to them when I do it through settings. But alexa (echo dot) takes forever. Why?! Then you exit, try again, but she lists them as a decice she knows BUT IS NOT PAIRED TO. PAIR TO THE GD SPEAKERS FFS! You click on them in the list, app cooks then finally pairs. Does alexa say anything to automatcally confirm she's using the speakers? No. So you have to ask her something stupid to get her to speak and see if shes using the speakers. This way more painful then it should be. You can make a list using her, but to delete it \"use the app\". Why? DELETE THE GD LIST WHEN I TELL YOU! And lists are useless. I make a list of songs. Tell alexa to play the songs in the list. Nope. She can't do that. I make a list of numbers. Give me the sum total of those numbers. Nope. They need to add WAY more functionality to lists if they're going to be of any use. They're basically one dimensional string arrays you cant do anything with. So close yet so far. Next we have the tplink smart plug amazon suggested we buy when we got the echo dot. Well we have a living room lamp thats a pita to turn on and off so it'd be great to just tell alexa to do that. Try to get that thing going is a pita in and of itself (plug in, install ANOTHER app, hook to it, hook to network, create yet another login, etc). Finally get it going as a smart plug. Now we have to pair it with alexa. Open skills, install more crap, look for device IN THE APP bc alexa is too stupid to pair using just voice, finally get them paired. \"Alexa turn on the (light name)\". \"I'm sorry I can't find that device.\" YES YOU CAN! I'M LOOKING AT IT RIGHT IN YOUR APP! I CAN EVEN USE YOUR APP TO MANUALLY TURN IT ON AND OFF! WHY CAN'T YOU VOICE COMMAND IT?! This was one of the reasons we got the echo dor and it CAN'T DO IT'S GD JOB! They need to make alexa be able to do more of this maintenance crap through her instead of this stupid app. They need to standardize smart devices and get rid of skills. But if they force you to install skills, FIX THE GD SEARCH. This app is painful and makes me want to get rid of alexa.",

		"review": "This app is without a doubt the worst, slowest, least responsive, badly engineered app that I have ever seen. And that‚Äôs with full WiFi reception. \n\nHowever, if you‚Äôre not successful you can always call their help dept. and speak to a rep. The one that I got was minimally conversant in English and had what sounded like an Indian accent- as did all the other people in the room. Not surprisingly, I received no help. \n\nI did, however, receive an email from Amazon with a request to complete a survey. I complied, explaining my problem and basically asking that they call me. 	{
		"review": "We initially generally liked the app, although we found it somewhat confusing and unintuitive. Then I was spontaneous logged out of the App while travelling. Aside from the annoying process of having to enter cryptogram images, I tried over and over again to login. Each time the app would look like it was accepting my login, only to return me to a fresh login screen. \nI contacted the ‚Äúhelp‚Äù desk via chat.  I was passed from representative to representative on chat, with representatives changing, even in the early stages of our conversation and without notice or explanation for the change. I was told to do things that I had told them I had already done. In the end I was told they would send my case to engineering. I received a simple email of things to try while I waited for a response. That email was a restatement of all the things that were all the basic things that the chat ‚Äúhelpers‚Äù had stubbornly suggested, even though I had already told them I had done those things. \nAfter again trying to restart my phone, the resumed chat help seemed to have no knowledge of my previous questions. \nFinally, when I heard from engineering I wrote back to say that I had finally gotten the app to connect, for no apparent reason, and after days of trying. \nI asked on question : Does the app not work when traveling outside the USA?\nInstead of getting a reply, I‚Äôve now received another email offering to help ‚Äúsolve my problem‚Äù, again with no apparent awareness of my specific situation, and asking me to call. \nI have given hours of my time to this annoying app and unhelpful process. \nI will not call. \nI will use the app that now seems to be working. \nIf I have further problems, I will return the device and will not waste my time re-engaging with the unhelpful Alexa help desk. \nIt‚Äôs too bad the service is so bad since my family was initially enjoying the Echo/Alexa products.",

		"review": "The computer age for me is admittedly one or two generations younger than I am. So, even though I can't possibly comprehend all the potential within this app, the sheer fascination with it earns the highest rating I can give. The consistent problem I have is the avalanche of research necessary to plod through learning how to use it. Normally I would give a lower rating because of the mandated learning curve. Yet, everything we have been able to apply has not only been useful, but fun. Consider this: when I was a kid, my parents sometimes still read by candle light. True story. 	{
		"review": "Here are some helpful tips or troubleshooting that you can do if ever you are encountering some problems in your Echo devices:  *Connecting to your Wifi/Internet -make sure youre not connecting to a adhoc networks, and echo devices requires fast and stable connection so dont expect it to function properly if your connection isnt stable,  -Go to your alexa app>menu (three horizontal lines at the upper left hand of the screen) > settings>choose your echo device>update wifi and follow the steps in setting up your echo device -if you get an error message, make sure that you entered your wifi password correctly, restart your echo device, power cycle your router, reset if still not working or use a different device (even though some of your devices work properly with your wifi connection, the echo device is different, sometimes it depends on the compatibility of your router thats why you should check your ISP as well.)  *Echo device is not responding  -always check if the mic button on the echo device if it is RED because it means that its on MUTE and check on the alexa app if its offline or online.  -sometimes the echo device needs some refreshing, you can restart it by unplugging it from your power source and after full 20 seconds plug it back on again. -or you can move your device closer to your router -or you can power cycle your router -you can reset it as well but resetting the echo device is resetting everything and youre going to set it up again.    Learning is important and doing this basic troubleshootings can save time. Trust me this is based in experience and I know that this is frustrating and disappointing but still technology is not dormant so we should never stop learning as well. It may solve your issues and instead of calling support for this you can save your time :)   -Emblem.",
		"author": "Darlene Petilla",
		"review_source": "GooglePlayStore",
		"rating": 5,
		"title": "",
		"product_name": "Amazon Alexa",
		"reviewed_date": "2017-06-12T00:00:00.000Z"
	},

		"review": "Very slow to launch even on modern devices. I have to wait over a minute for the app to launch, just to add an item to my shopping list. Much less than I expect from Amazon. Disappointing in its current implementation. ------- I'm knocking off another star, because after a year, these issues still persist. 	{
		"review": "This app was barely passable from the start and hasn't really improved much over time. The shopping list got an office mode a little while back but you can still expect to wait forever to get to it if the phone even thinks there might be a network connection. We can't the app open to cached data and refresh in the background?  Worse, if it suddenly finds a connection it will go back to the home page.   The rest of the features are similarly half-baked and poorly tested. The app is ok for checking up on your Echo but not much else.  Finally, on the latest update Amazon suddenly needs access to every permission on the phone.  Contact list, running apps, phone calls, everything. 		"review": "Drop In on Dots is 1 out of 5 stars. I've got excellent bandwidth and an awesome wireless router. After getting the fancy email, I felt very excited about Drop In. It's not solid, fades in and out, the volume is too low and uses the onboard speaker, breaking the bluetooth connection to that speaker, and is an embarrassment. 	{
		"review": "Disappointing. Both Echo and the Alexa app. The weather skill can't even tell you humidity. Now, as of July 28, control of Wemo devices has become erratic and semi-functional. I have updated Wemo device firmware, re-enabled the Wemo account connection, re-dscovered devices within the Alexa app, but it's still extremely retarded, with very long delays between the command and whatever execution it decides to implement (which varies from attempt to attempt.) I might blame Wemo, since it's a terrible app as well, but all devices are currently working fine from the Wemo app. My main motivation with Alexa/Echo was home automation control, but it's not reliable. Waking up to a noise, and saying \"Alexa; lights on\" should, you know, turn on the lights. But Alexa hesitates for a substantial period of time, then might (or might not) turn on a totally random selection of Wemo devices. Not ready for Prime time, pun intended. Alexa and my Echo devices are mostly just music streaming speakers now, and the only devices with a decent speaker for that purpose are the tall original Echos. Besides, with Amazon devices, unlike Google Home, you can't get the same stream coordinated on multiple devices concurrently. The Echo Show speakers are very directional (and the device is also hard of hearing.) If I could undo the whole mess, I would today.",

		"review": "The app disconnects my wifi causing my data to be used at an alarming rate. Not the Echo, the app. This app. Without the app being installed on my Galaxy 7, I can use my Amazon Echo, play music, enable skills, etc and as long as I'm connected to my wifi I use NO data. But when I install this app, and even if I am not using the Echo, my data allowance begins to burn away rapidly.  When I put my phone down & my screen times out, my wifi gets disconnected.  When I use my phone and open the screen, I see a popup telling my my wifi has been connected... meaning it was disconnected during the phones down time. 	{
		"review": "Not sure why so many bad reviews. Seems a lot of reviews are on the device itself and not the app. 2 totally different things. Once paired you really don't need the app. App works great and always has same with the echo itself. Never had 1 issue. It understands me 99.9% of the time the other .1% is because either the tv is too loud but not the device itself. Someone was talking carp about searching music. Just say a name of a song or artist and it will be played. I think most reviews are due to user error and not the device. Sure the app could use a little work but for the most part it works flawlessly. Easy to find skills and set alarms, add more devices and link my smart home devices. I don't know why people say it's hard to connect to WiFi because it is the easiest device I've ever hooked up to my wifi. Its never lost connection either. Only when the power has gone out but as soon as it's back on so is alexa. I have over 70 devices paired with the app and alexa has not once messed up when giving a command to lock a door or turn on a light. I would definitely recommend it over Google home any day.",

	{
		"review": "Fourth Update:  Amazon/Alexa did allow this station back on-line, so all is well, for now.  No complaints at this time.  Great service, and great device (I have the Tap).  So 5 Stars.  Hope it stays this way.  ////  Update:  Wow!  So now we're purging conservative radio stations from the Amazon/Alexa feed, huh?  I tried to ask Alexa to play my favorite radio station, and I got back \"105.9 FM WMAL on iHeart Radio isn't available right now.\"  Just to make sure it wasn't a temporary glitch, I waited and asked again, and got the same, only restated: \"105.9 FM WMAL on iHeart Radio is currently not available.\"  Which is funny (NOT), 'cause I can go straight to iHeart Radio on my Android tablet, and it immediately plays, just fine.  Amazon, you had better stop boycotting/purging stations just 'cause you don't like their content!  Not happy at all with Amazon over this.  Fix now!  Immediately!  Or you will be reported to the FCC!  ////  Second Update:  Finally, Landscape Mode has been restored!!  Thank you, Amazon, for providing this update for all of us tablet owners, and for the disabled who rely on Landscape Mode for their special devices.  As I said before, this has always been a 5 Star application.  Brilliantly thought out.  Superbly executed.  Great UI.  Now that it supports tablets, it is perfect.  Thanks again, Amazon!  BVI User.  ////  First Update: After calling and emailing Amazon, Landscape Mode has still not been restored for their handicapped/disabled users.  Numerous reviews have been posted by other handicapped/disabled people asking why, and no response from Amazon.  Poor customer response and service.  So, down to One Star you go.  What a shame, for an otherwise responsible and squared-away company.  Pay attention to your handicapped/disabled users!  ////  This would have been a 5 Star review...  Until yesterday.  Minus One Star for taking away Landscape Mode.  Hey, some of out here have large screen tablets and are not gonna twist them around just to see your app's screen.  Those of us with Visual Impairments need the widescreen display.  Please make the orientation an option, Landscape or Portrait.  Minus One Star for removing the identifying colors and symbols for our music apps.  Again, those of us with Visual Impairments used to be able to find our iHeartRadio app by looking for the \"red square.\"  The TuneIn Radio app was easily located by looking for the \"aqua square.\"  Granted, I'm sure that the black & white menus look very modern and sophisticated, but they're not friendly for the Visually Impaired.  Please add an option to put the color back.  Otherwise, great app!  I can control my Tap from either my tablet or new iPhone seamlessly.  Just please be considerate of us Visually Impaired people.  Thanks.  5 Stars once you provide these options.  BVI user.",

	{
		"review": "If I could give this app a negative review I would. I'm not a huge fan of my dot to begin with but the app just destroys any positive feelings I might have had.   One of the biggest things I use the app for is text to speech on my Kindle books. Not only can I not arrange how I want the icons to look or hide services I don't use, but I can't   search through my books for the title I want or sort them. It is also virtually impossible to just say \"Alexa read XXXXX\" because she has no idea what I'm talking about.  My roommate foumd the same thing when she tried to get the app to read to her. You have to dig through all the books to find the one you want and then hit play.   Also, Alexa is extremely  spotty with pronunciation (i.e., a character whose name is Manny sometimes gets called Man, sometimes pronounced Many and sometimes pronounced Manny; a character named Colin is sometimes prounced like Cawlin and sometimes like Colon).  All that being said, the biggest thing I hate about the app is that it randomly stops, as if a sleep timer went off and it stops reading. If I wake her up by saying \"Alexa\", she reads a few more words and then stops or she will randomly start reading again (i.e., a 3 am the book will come back on for a sentence or two and then will stop again). This would continue the whole book if I let it. Amazon says it's most likely the internet connection but I can tell you it absolutely is not.   I realize Alexa was a pioneer in AI in her early days, but one would think Amazon would have improved her since then. Not so much.",

	{
		"review": "Well, the set up is straight forward. You need to ask the questions as dead on as u can or she either ignore the question or selects the wrong song/play list. I have been using the timer & reminder function for cooking. And of course to not to forget to do something. It is a matter of getting familiar with the settings. The music part is handy for work or for relaxing. The best parts are asking for the time, weather, questions that come to you out of nowhere. As example, recipes for parties. You can have the recipes sent to your phone so don't need to search for pen or paper. Keep in mind as always there are many things you can do with this app. You can listen to weather, keep up with the news by going to the My Skills section. This app is the backbone of Alexa. Once set up & paired it can be a very helpful app. For the one star reviewers to me you need to keep in mind new features are added as the app evolves.",

	{
		"review": "Lately, all of my Echo devices are constantly telling me that there was a problem executing the command or that the device lost its connection. All my other devices are connected with no issues and this happens while my FireTV is steadily streaming (and yes, I have more than enough bandwidth for multiple streams, etc). This is most frustrating. The music groups are useless because if you have your device connected to a Bluetooth speaker, it severs the connection and plays the music thru the device (which sounds horrible on a Dot). Furthermore, the Tap can't be added to a music group. Calling one of your other devices is interesting, but it would be more useful as an intercom without having to \"answer\" with a command. (I want to give my 3-year-old instructions in another room, but he can't answer the call) Calling another device also severs any Bluetooth connections. 	{
		"review": "Super easy to use if you have good WiFi and actually know how to use technology and aren't an old fart complaining because you can't figure it out. It's nothing more than a tablet without a screen but i love it. It's like a tablet for your mind if you learn it, use it enough, and train it and it can really fit seamlessly into your life. Being able to walk into my house and play a song i wish i had heard on the radio just by saying hey Alexa play \"whatever\" or being able to ask her to continue my sports talk show when i walk in is such a simple feature but so cool. It's nice to not have to find a new device when i walk in to reconnect everything i was listening to. The Echo Dot solves all those problems and there price is great. 		"review": "I love my new Echo! It is really cool! On tablets the calling and texting feature doesn't work but here's a way to fix it. 1. Type Amazon account into your web browser, and click the 1st or 2nd result and sign in and add the phone number you just got; follow the instructions. 3. Borrow a friend's compatible phone and sign in with your amazon account, then click the middle button on the bottom, follow the instructions. DO NOT ALLOW CONTACTS. IF YOU DO ALL YOUR FRIEND'S CONTACTS WILL BE ADDED TO YOUR ECHO, AND MESS THE WHOLE THING UP. If you've followed these steps, try calling on your Echo. 		"review": "Alexa's functions are always improving (after all, she's only a few years old) and I absolutely love the convenience she's added to my life; however, I'm surprised to see that this app is still struggling with some basic functionality issues (for example: the inability to see the text I'm entering whenever I provide feedback or give a review for a given skill, unless the text window I'm typing in is completely within the top portion of the screen--while all other apps adjust the window, as needed, to accommodate the keyboard pop-up, this app doesn't even allow you to scroll it up manually while the keyboard is present). 	{
		"review": "No where near as easy to use as Google Assistant / Home apps... No material design for Android... No native option to open Alexa, whereas Google Assistant just hold the home button... Big thing is I don't need to buy hardware with Google for it to work (just use your phone if you want, don't buy any speakers), Amazon are really trying to push you spending money on Echo devices. Also Google Assistant is far far more natural in understanding what you are saying, Alexa requires very precise commands and doesn't always get them right, and I hate the excuse people are saying that \"you have to make your own 'skills'\", no I really shouldn't need too! This should have machine learning and just understand me however I say it! Google does that perfectly by comparison... And one final thing, I can access, control and delete all my user data with Google, Amazon on the other hand - nothing, and yet Google is apparently the \"bad boy\" for user data mining!... 		"review": "I give this app 2 stars for the vital functionality it provides to administer your Echo devices. I have to play a song to change the volume in my kids room which means if it‚Äôs up high they get blasted at night when I‚Äôm starting sleep music remotely. And the downhill slide continues. \n\nSept 2017 review-This app continues to devolve with each update. As of the latest update you now have to manually select music for your other dot or echo if you want them both to play. I keep the echo music on all day and when I shower, I stream from my dot to the shower radio. 	{
		"review": "Continued problems with external Bluetooth speaker for Dot. What the hell are these developers doing? They are literally forcing people to google and Apple. In the good ole days before this app became too bloated for its on good, i could turn on my external Bluetooth speaker, ask my Alexa Dot to play music and it would automatically play through my external speaker. Those days are gone people!! LISTEN TO ME!!!! THEY ARE GONE!! NO MORE!!! Now I have to pair the dot and speaker each time I want to use the external speaker. It‚Äôs a multi-step time consuming process. These developers must be getting minimum wage as there is absolutely no incentive to get an app out there that works. They fix one thing and break another. I‚Äôm on the verge of going with Apple new home device, or even google for that matter. \n\nFeb 2018 review. My external blue tooth speaker will no longer work with Alexa Dot. Period! It took some figuring out but now, instead of turning on Alexa music, then my blue tooth shower radio and instantly hearing music, I have to go into settings, blue tooth, and manually connect my external speaker each time. Add to that the fact that ‚Äúrecent‚Äù music stations rarely work now. I have to go directly to the Tunein option and start music from there. And the downhill slide continues. \n\nSept 2017 review-This app continues to devolve with each update. As of the latest update you now have to manually select music for your other dot or echo if you want them both to play. I keep the echo music on all day and when I shower, I stream from my dot to the shower radio. If I ask Dot alexa to play 60's music, she says you already have a device playing and would I rather hear it on this device. If you say yes, my echo turns off and the dot plays. Certainly Bezo's can hire better developers than this. \n\nI still cannot fathom the idea that the developers think this update is an improvement. It is the exact opposite. Volume control and \"now playing \" features are no longer static at the bottom of the screen. Latest version May 9, 2017 cripples the ability to quickly access volume control on iPhone. Can take as many as 4 steps just to get to a volume button. And the time between these steps is not \"snappy\", if you will. The finger slide volume control is buggy. You can't even see the volume number because it's directly under your finger tip. Pitiful pitiful implementation. App is clunky and slow to respond to touches on iPhone 6 plus. I would love to revert to the older version.",

	{
		"review": "I‚Äôll adjust my review on more serious topics discussing this application. But until this app is cleaned up and optimized for the latest iPhone, that has been put for a quarter of a year, I can‚Äôt honestly review it.\n\nAmazon, please clean this app up.",

		"reviewed_date": "2018-02-15T11:29:17.000Z"
	},
	{
		"review": "So there was an update to the Alexa app Feb 14, 2018. As usual, nothing specific listed in the update description other than the usual rubber stamped ‚Äúimprovements‚Äù crap. But many problems still persist. Automatic Bluetooth connection to external speakers (Dot) is still a thing of the past. Now requires multi-step paring each time. The app is total garbage!\n\nContinued problems with external Bluetooth speaker for Dot. What the hell are these developers doing? They are literally forcing people to google and Apple. In the good ole days before this app became too bloated for its on good, i could turn on my external Bluetooth speaker, ask my Alexa Dot to play music and it would automatically play through my external speaker. Those days are gone people!! LISTEN TO ME!!!! THEY ARE GONE!! NO MORE!!! Now I have to pair the dot and speaker each time I want to use the external speaker. It‚Äôs a multi-step time consuming process. These developers must be getting minimum wage as there is absolutely no incentive to get an app out there that works. They fix one thing and break another. I‚Äôm on the verge of going with Apple new home device, or even google for that matter. \n\nFeb 2018 review. My external blue tooth speaker will no longer work with Alexa Dot. Period! It took some figuring out but now, instead of turning on Alexa music, then my blue tooth shower radio and instantly hearing music, I have to go into settings, blue tooth, and manually connect my external speaker each time. Add to that the fact that ‚Äúrecent‚Äù music stations rarely work now. I have to go directly to the Tunein option and start music from there. And the downhill slide continues. \n\nSept 2017 review-This app continues to devolve with each update. As of the latest update you now have to manually select music for your other dot or echo if you want them both to play. I keep the echo music on all day and when I shower, I stream from my dot to the shower radio. If I ask Dot alexa to play 60's music, she says you already have a device playing and would I rather hear it on this device. If you say yes, my echo turns off and the dot plays. Certainly Bezo's can hire better developers than this. \n\nI still cannot fathom the idea that the developers think this update is an improvement. It is the exact opposite. Volume control and \"now playing \" features are no longer static at the bottom of the screen. Latest version May 9, 2017 cripples the ability to quickly access volume control on iPhone. Can take as many as 4 steps just to get to a volume button. And the time between these steps is not \"snappy\", if you will. The finger slide volume control is buggy. You can't even see the volume number because it's directly under your finger tip. Pitiful pitiful implementation. App is clunky and slow to respond to touches on iPhone 6 plus. I would love to revert to the older version.",
